intro: Pavetta borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, simple, and often elliptical leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and have five petals, with white or pale pink hues. It is often found in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests.
